intro: Adenostemma brasilianum, commonly known as Brazilian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Adenostemma brasilianum is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
